conclusion: To solve the problem, analyze the motion of the conductor rod in the magnetic field, calculate the induced EMF, and determine the power of the external force.

The image shows a semi-circular conductor frame with radius r centered at point O. A conductor rod OC can slide along the frame. A resistor R is connected between O and C. The frame is in a uniform magnetic field with induction B. The rod rotates uniformly with angular velocity ω.
The conductor rod OC moves in a circular path with radius r and angular velocity ω.
The magnetic flux through the area swept by OC is calculated as Φ = B · (1/2) r^2 ω t.
The induced EMF 𝓔 is given by the rate of change of the magnetic flux: 𝓔 = -B · (1/2) r^2 ω.
The power P of the external force doing work is given by the product of the induced EMF and the current I in the circuit: P = 𝓔 · I.
Since the resistances are negligible, the current I is determined by the resistor R: I = 𝓔/R.
Substitute the expression for 𝓔 into the power equation: P = -B · (1/2) r^2 ω · (1/R).
The negative sign indicates the direction of the power, but for the purpose of this problem, consider the absolute value: P = B · (1/2) r^2 ω.
The power of the external force doing work is B · (1/2) r^2 ω.
